thread.title: Eddie Howe worried 'incredible' Zlatan Ibrahimovic will plunge Bournemouth deeper into relegation quagmire
thread.title_full: Eddie Howe worried 'incredible' Zlatan Ibrahimovic will plunge Bournemouth deeper into relegation quagmire

author: Alex Crook
title: Eddie Howe worried 'incredible' Zlatan Ibrahimovic will plunge Bournemouth deeper into relegation quagmire
text:
Sport Eddie Howe worried 'incredible' Zlatan Ibrahimovic will plunge Bournemouth deeper into relegation quagmire The Swde has netted none goals in 2017 - only one fewer that the Cherries have managed between them Share Howe fears the Manchester United frontman (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Eddie Howe fears ‘incredible’ Zlatan Ibrahimovic will plunge Bournemouth deeper into relegation turmoil after tipping the Manchester United ace to be crowned player of the year. 
EFL Cup final hero Ibrahimovic has scored nine goals in 11 games in 2017 – only one fewer than the WHOLE of Howe’s misfiring Cherries team. 
Howe said: “Zlatan is definitely a candidate for player of the season. Take his age out of it, it’s what he has achieved this season and what he has done. 
“We played against United on the first day of the season I was very impressed by him. He took his goal well and he has gone on to prove how good he is. Ibrahimovic was United's match winner at Wembley (Photo: PA Wire) 
“His sheer number of goals is incredible and his appetite for the game impressed me last week with how he approached that cup final. The Cherries have been sliding towards the relegation zone (Photo: Reuters) 
“Even in interviews after you can see how he is built to achieve the success he has. I’m appreciating him on a football level. “ 
Bournemouth are only four points above the bottom three after failing to win since December. 
But Howe, who masterminded their amazing rise from League Two to the Premier League, said: “I do see Bournemouth in the Premier League next season, our destiny is in our own hands.” poll loading Will Manchester United beat Bournemouth on Saturday? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
